definition: paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: I had noting in the world but a million-pound note.
sentences.chinese: 除了一张百万英磅的钞票外，我一无所有。

sentences.english: His wallet contained a five-dollar bill.
sentences.chinese: 他钱包里有张五美元的钞票。

sentences.english: Open your wallet and take out a one-dollar bill.
sentences.chinese: 打开钱包，把一张一美元的钞票拿出来。

sentences.english: Morgan:No wonder the department stores earn billions in a single day.
sentences.chinese: 难怪百货公司可以在一天就赚进上亿的钞票。

sentences.english: Soon, Nacho and his partner are making a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 奈奇和他的搭档很快就赚进大把钞票。
你拿来那张一百万英镑的钞票了吗？

sentences.english: In desperation, the husband took out a five-dollar bill and waved it above the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 无奈，丈夫拿出一张五美元的钞票在人群上面摇晃晃。

sentences.english: It took some convincing, but I did manage to get a few of the girls to pick up the bills--finally.
sentences.chinese: 经过一番劝解，最终我成功地让几个女孩拿起了钞票。

sentences.english: Back in his room he unrolled it and found a hundred-dollar bill.
sentences.chinese: 他回到屋里打开一看，原来是一张一百元的钞票。

sentences.english: I can't change a ten-pound note.
This is a card and bill transpo that gets screams! A bill is borrowed, folded and placed into the spectators hand.
sentences.chinese: 向观众借一张钞票，对折后放到观众手中握紧。
您能找开一张100元面值的钞票吗？

sentences.english: I plopped a $20 bill on the counter.
sentences.chinese: 我把一张20美元的钞票甩在柜台上。

sentences.english: In desperation, the husband took out a five-dollar bill and waved it above the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 无奈，丈夫拿出一张五美元的钞票在人群上面摇晃。

sentences.english: Then, reaching under his pillow, he pulled out some more crumpled up bills.
sentences.chinese: 然后，他伸手到枕头下摸出几张皱皱巴巴的钞票。

sentences.english: First he brought the bills and then the loose receipts of the day.
sentences.chinese: 他先拿了那些钞票，然后又拿了当天进的散钱。

definition: (in former times) banknote with a value in silver
false paper money burned as an offering to the dead
banknote in Jiao units (Mao, one-tenth of yuan)
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
